qas.question: What legislative act provided that no Indian nation shall be acknowledged as an independent nation with whom the United States may contract by treaty?
By what did the US federal government provide contractual relations with Indian tribes following the Indian Appropriations Act of March 3, 1871?
Prior to what year did the United States regularly enter into treaties with Native Americans?
A rider to the Indian Appropriations Act of 1871 provided that no Indian nation shall be acknowledged as what?

answers.text: an independent nation, tribe, or power

qas.question: A rider to the Indian Appropriations Act of 1871 provided that the US government could not do what with an Indian nation?

context: Prior to <a2_0>1871<a2_0/>, the government of the United States regularly entered into treaties with Native Americans but the <a0_0>Indian Appropriations Act of March 3, 1871<a0_0/> (ch. 120, 16 Stat. 563) had a rider (25 U.S.C. § 71) attached that effectively ended the President’s treaty making by providing that no Indian nation or tribe shall be acknowledged as <a3_0>an independent nation, tribe, or power<a3_0/> with whom the United States may <a4_0>contract by treaty<a4_0/>. The federal government continued to provide similar contractual relations with the Indian tribes after 1871 by <a1_0>agreements, statutes, and executive orders<a1_0/>.
